## GAD-7 vs ASI

The comparison between the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and Anxiety Sensitivity Index (16-item) (ASI) often poses a significant challenge to psychologists. With different formats, items, and evaluation scales, making an objective comparison between GAD-7 and ASI is a tedious process. Harmony, a software developed specifically for psychologists that simplifies this process, can be an invaluable tool in this context. Harmony, leveraging natural language processing and generative AI models, facilitates effortless harmonisation between different psychological assessment tools like GAD-7 and ASI. Harmonyâ€™s large language models are capable of comparing the instruments and providing a percentage match between each item in GAD-7 and ASI. This comparison not only makes the process enormously efficient but also eliminates any subjective biases. To utilise Harmony's comparative capabilities for GAD-7 Vs ASI, you can simply select these instruments from Harmony's database or manually upload your PDF versions. It allows psychologists to drill down each item, identify similarities and differences, and streamline their research process. The comparisons made by Harmony are comprehensive, accurate, and applicable across different languages. Therefore, GAD-7 vs ASI is made far more simpler and objective, ensuring enhanced efficiency and improved research outcomes.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and ASI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and ASI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just ASI into Harmony</a> - compare ASI with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
